title: 112_hr914
content: The Act titled "Federal Internship Improvement Act" establishes federal internship programs. The "Federal Internship Improvement Act" establishes federal internship programs under Subchapter I of chapter 31 of title 5, United States Code. Each agency must appoint an internship coordinator and provide online information on application procedures and deadlines. The Office will create a centralized database of individuals completing internships seeking full-time Federal employment. Agencies must conduct exit interviews and submit annual reports on their internship programs to the Office. The report for an agency's internship program must include the number of interns, demographic information, efforts to increase permanent job offers, and barriers encountered. The report for an agency's internship program should include details on recruiting new interns, diversity of work roles, mentorship programs, and exit interviews/surveys with interns. Reports must be submitted between September 1 and September 30 each year, with a summary report to Congress by December 30. The Office must submit an annual report to Congress summarizing information on internship programs, including volunteer service programs, the Student Educational Employment Program (SCEP), and programs by non-government organizations providing paid internships. The Code of Federal Regulations defines an intern as an individual in an internship program within an Executive agency. A clerical amendment was made to the table of sections for chapter 31 of title 5, United States Code. Federal internship programs.
